snippet: The compromises accepted by City Council Speaker Christine C. Quinn to win business and labor support for the measure mean that it will have a shorter reach than originally expected.
abstract: New York City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn has accepted a number of compromises to living wage bill in an effort to win business and labor support for the measure; number of exemptions added since the bill was initially announced means a shorter reach than originally expected, with the possibility that only 400-500 low-wage workers a year will benefit.
lead_paragraph: The compromises accepted by City Council Speaker Christine C. Quinn to win business and labor support for the measure mean that it will have a shorter reach than originally expected.

headline.seo: N.Y. Living-Wage Bill, After Christine Quinn’s Tweaks, Has Shorter Reach
headline.main: With Tweaks, Quinn’s Living-Wage Bill Aims Lower
headline.print_headline: With Tweaks, Quinn’s Living-Wage Bill Scales Back Its Ambitions
